comments:
I200406040800
- Am working on a creating a testcase for testing the addition of a dynamic 
plugin.  When the test runs, I get the following in my .log file (even though 
the test succeeds):
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 0 Jun 04, 2004 14:34:50.789
!MESSAGE Error notifying registry change listener.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 0 Jun 04, 2004 14:34:50.789
!MESSAGE 
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.FlushableExtension.getConfigurationElements
(FlushableExtension.java:22)
	at 
org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.PerspectiveRegistry.buildNewCacheObject
(PerspectiveRegistry.java:524)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.RegistryManager.add
(RegistryManager.java:121)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.RegistryManager.registryChanged
(RegistryManager.java:102)
	at 
org.eclipse.core.internal.registry.ExtensionRegistry$ExtensionEventDispatcherJo
b.run(ExtensionRegistry.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

We don't have this test in the CVS repository right now.  Please come and see 
me if you need help reproducing this problem.

Can we fix this for RC2? #getRegistry can return null but there are several
places that don't handle this...

Debbie, were you by any chance dynamically removing the plugin right after
adding it? That would explain why the extension does now about its registry anymore.

Never tried to remove the plug-in, but the test will likely shutdown soon 
after the check.

Investigated the problem with Debbie. This was both a problem with the test case
itself and with the utility class Debbie was using to install plugins (provided
by us), causing it to fail when running with an existing configuration.

We should add a test case for when a bundle is installed, resolved and then
re-resolved. This should cause the registry objects to be removed, and new ones
to be re-created (generating two events, a REMOVED and a ADDED, on this order).
During our investigation I am pretty sure we saw a situation where only a
REMOVED event was issued (at least this is what the registry debug listener showed).
This can be done later (it is a test issue).

UI is fine with this as the test utility to install plugins has been changed 
so we no longer see this NPE.
Added test case to runtime tests.
I have this strange habit of marking bugs targetting RC* as M*...
